name: find_tiles
example_code: local all_red_tiles = field:find_tiles( function( tile ) return tile:get_team() == Team.Red end )
example_comment: The above snippet shows two ways of passing a function to `find_tiles()`.
description: Iterates through all of the <%=tile%>s on the battlefield, and returns a list of <%=tile%>s that match a filter `function`.
To *include* a <%=tile%> in the final list, the filter `function` has to return `true`.
If it returns `false` for a <%=tile%>, it will *not* be included.

parameters.name: search_function
parameters.desc: A filter function that determines if the <%=tile%> gets added to the list.

text: `search_function` requires **one** <%=tile%> parameter, and to return a `boolean`.
Return `true` for any <%=tile%> that you *do* want to include.
Return `false` for any <%=tile%> that you *do not* want to include.
_The function does **not** have to be named `search_function`, it is just for illustrative purposes._
footnotes.comment: When used with the above snippet, `find_tiles()` returns all <%=tile%>s that are currently owned by the Red team.
